newsitem.title: RUSSIA: Cessna sees Citation VII sales in Russia.
newsitem.headline: Cessna sees Citation VII sales in Russia.

text.p: U.S. aircraft maker Cessna Aircraft Co presented its new Citation VII business jet to potential Russian customers on Wednesday and said it saw the market as promising.
"Really, this country is very promising...we feel that new Russian rich people and firms will buy our jets," sales director Tom Perry told reporters at Moscow Sheremetyevo airport.
Cessna is a unit of Textron Inc.
Officials of leading Russian oil and gas companies and of big banks were at the ceremony.
Any purchases of the $10 million jets would add to a fleet of just 15 business jets in Russia.

An unnamed official of a private charter company told Reuters his firm was very interested in buying a Citation VII. "It's more expensive compared with Russian-made planes, but more luxurious. This plane can attract new clients," he said.
